thread.title: LPGA players arrive for US$2 mil. tournament
thread.title_full: LPGA players arrive for US$2 mil. tournament

title: LPGA players arrive for US$2 mil. tournament
text:
LPGA players arrive for US$2 mil. tournament CNAOctober 20, 2015, 12:09 am TWN SHARE Tweet TAIPEI -- Golfers from around the world have been arriving in Taiwan over the past two days for the US$2 million Fubon LPGA Taiwan Championship, the Taiwan leg of the LPGA tour. 
The players, including world No. 2 Lydia Ko and Jessica Korda, who won the LPGA Malaysia event that just concluded on Oct. 11, were met by fans when they arrived at Taiwan Taoyuan International Airport on Monday. 
Other players who arrived Monday were world No. 10 Suzann Pettersen of Norway, world No. 16 Na Yeon Choi and world No. 8 Amy Yang of South Korea, and world No. 23 Michelle Wie of the United States. 
Taiwan's Yani Tseng, whose subpar seasons the past two years have hurt local interest in her home event, may have rekindled interest with three top-five finishes in her last four LPGA tournaments. 
"If I could win the (Taiwan) championship, that would be the best result," the 26-year-old said at the airport Sunday. 
Tseng's recent run of good finishes, raising hopes that her victory drought dating back to March 2012 could soon come to an end, has improved the former world No. 1's world ranking to 37th this week from 75th on Aug. 24. 
Her most recent success was a second-place finish at the LPGA KEB Hana Bank Championship in South Korea this past weekend. 
The Fubon LPGA Taiwan Championship will be played from Oct. 22 to 25 at the Miramar Golf Country Club in New Taipei, with seven of the world's top 10 players, including Ko, Yang and Pettersen, set to compete in the 81-player field. SHARE
